alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued October 21 at 10:56PM PDT until October 22 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 45 to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...In California, far eastern Modoc County including the Warner Mountains. In Oregon, far Eastern Klamath County and most of Lake County. * WHEN...Until 2 PM PDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds are expected over the higher terrain, along highway 31 near Summer Lake, and exposed areas of highway 395 from Lakeview northward. These areas may see an isolated wind gust or two of 60 mph. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
